meanings.definition: To employ too many staff members.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant decided to overstaff for the busy holiday season.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overstaff to avoid unnecessary expenses.
meanings.sent3: The office manager accidentally overstaffed the team, and they all ended up playing cards.
meanings.sent4: The garden was overstaffed with so many flowers that it looked like a colorful carpet.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's classroom was overstaffed with eager students ready to learn.

meanings.definition: Having an excessive number of staff members.
meanings.sent1: The overstaff team struggled to find tasks for everyone to do.
meanings.sent2: The company became overstaff after hiring too many employees during the expansion.
meanings.sent3: The overstaff office party had more people than chairs, so they had to stand.
meanings.sent4: The overstaff department felt like a bustling beehive with everyone buzzing around.
meanings.sent5: The overstaff hotel lobby was filled with employees ready to assist guests at any moment.
